qas.question: Who was the doctor related to?
Who did the relative of the doctor marry?
Who met their husbands at the Hampton institute?
What tribe was Eastman related to?
How many African-American teachers married Indigenous American men they had met at Hampton Institute?
What was the name of the woman Seth Eastman married?
Who was a lawyer of European and Sioux ancestry?
Who did Seth Eastman have a son with?
Where was Seth Eastman stationed in South Dakota?

context: In the late 19th century, <a3_0><b5_0>three<b5_0/> European-American middle-class female teachers<a3_0/> married Indigenous American men they had met at Hampton Institute during the years when it ran its Indian program. In the late nineteenth century, <a0_0><b7_0>Charles Eastman<b7_0/><a0_0/>, a physician of European and <a4_0>Sioux<a4_0/> ancestry who trained at Boston University, married <b6_0>Elaine Goodale<b6_0/>, a European-American woman from New England. They met and worked together in Dakota Territory when she was Superintendent of Indian Education and he was a doctor for the reservations. His maternal grandfather was <a1_0>Seth Eastman<a1_0/>, an artist and Army officer from New England, who had married a <a2_0><b8_0>Sioux woman<b8_0/><a2_0/> and had a daughter with her while stationed at <b9_0>Fort Snelling<b9_0/> in Minnesota.
